text: Double album Love Yourself: Answer, due out on August 24, will feature 25 tracks – including the previously released The Truth Untold and Fake Love – but only seven are new South Korean boy band phenomenon BTS have revealed the tracklist for their upcoming seventh studio album, which is due to be released on August 24. BigHit Entertainment, the studio behind BTS, announced on Twitter on Sunday that Love Yourself: Answer would be a double album featuring 25 tracks. However, fans would have already heard most of the songs on the previous two Love Yourself releases: Love Yourself: Her (released in September 2017) and Love Yourself: Tear (May 2018). Of the 25 songs on Love Yourself: Answer, only seven are new, including the much-anticipated track Epiphany, which was heard in the album’s promotional trailer released earlier this month. Previously released tracks include The Truth Untold (featuring US DJ Steve Aoki) and Fake Love, which topped the US world singles charts. With the release of Love Yourself: Tear earlier this year, BTS became the first K-pop group to rise to the top of the US album charts, a vivid illustration of the genre’s growing global appeal. Here is the full tracklist: Side A: Euphoria Trivia: Just Dance Serendipity (Full Length Edition) DNA Dimple Trivia: Love Her Singularity Fake Love The Truth Untold, Feat. Steve Aoki Trivia: Seesaw Tear Epiphany I’m Fine Idol Answer: Love Myself Side B: Magic Shop Best Of Me Airplane Go (Go Go) Anpanman MicDrop DNA (Pedal 2 LA Mix) Fake Love (Rocking Vibe Mix) Mic Drop (Steve Aoki Remix) [Full Length Edition]
title: K-pop boy band BTS reveal full tracklist for new album Love Yourself: Answer, including the much-anticipated song Epiphany | South China Morning Post
